intro: Sphaerocionium tenerrimum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically in shades of green or yellow. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slight pubescence. Sphaerocionium tenerrimum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
